imports.name: imports
imports.reference:
# <comment>You can import some other <info>yml</info> files.</comment>
imports:

    # Example:
    - .wf.base.yml

version.name: version
version.info: <comment>Which WF Makefile version do you want to use? You can combine it with the minimum WF version with the <info>@</info> symbol: <info>[base]@[wf_minimum_version]</info></comment>
version.reference:
# <comment>Which WF Makefile version do you want to use? You can combine it with the minimum WF version with the <info>@</info> symbol: <info>[base]@[wf_minimum_version]</info></comment>
version:              # Required, Example: 2.0.0@2.198

    # <comment>Which WF Makefile version do you want to use?</comment>
    base:                 ~ # Required, Example: 2.0.0

    # <comment>You can set what is the minimum WF version.</comment>
    wf_minimum_version:   null # Example: 2.198

base.name: base
base.info: <comment>Which WF Makefile version do you want to use?</comment>
base.reference:
# <comment>Which WF Makefile version do you want to use?</comment>
base:                 ~ # Required, Example: 2.0.0

wf_minimum_version.name: wf_minimum_version
wf_minimum_version.info: <comment>You can set what is the minimum WF version.</comment>
wf_minimum_version.reference:
# <comment>You can set what is the minimum WF version.</comment>
wf_minimum_version:   null # Example: 2.198

name.name: name
name.info: <comment>You have to set a name for the project. Avoid special characters and spaces, you should use latin characters and numbers, otherwise you can encounter problems.</comment>
name.reference:
# <comment>You have to set a name for the project. Avoid special characters and spaces, you should use latin characters and numbers, otherwise you can encounter problems.</comment>
name:                 ~ # Required

docker_data_dir.name: docker_data_dir
docker_data_dir.info: <comment>You can set an alternative docker data directory.</comment>
docker_data_dir.reference:
# <comment>You can set an alternative docker data directory.</comment>
docker_data_dir:      '%wf.target_directory%/.data'

commands.name: commands
commands.reference:
# <comment>You can add extra <info>commands</info>.</comment>
commands:

    # Prototype
    command:              ~

docker_compose.name: docker_compose
docker_compose.reference:
# <comment>Config the docker compose data.</comment>
docker_compose:

    # <comment>You can change the docker compose file version.</comment>
    version:              '3.4'

    # <comment>You can add extra <info>docker-compose.yml files</info>.</comment>
    include:              [] # Example: /home/user/dev.docker-compose.yml

    # <comment>Docker Compose yaml configuration. You mustn't use the <info>version</info> parameter, it will be automatically.</comment>
    extension:

        # Example:
        services:            
            web:                 
                volumes:             
                    - ~/dev/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/custom.conf
                environment:         
                    TEST:                1

version.name: version
version.info: <comment>You can change the docker compose file version.</comment>
version.reference:
# <comment>You can change the docker compose file version.</comment>
version:              '3.4'

include.name: include
include.reference:
# <comment>You can add extra <info>docker-compose.yml files</info>.</comment>
include:              [] # Example: /home/user/dev.docker-compose.yml

extension.name: extension
extension.info: <comment>Docker Compose yaml configuration. You mustn't use the <info>version</info> parameter, it will be automatically.</comment>
extension.reference:
# <comment>Docker Compose yaml configuration. You mustn't use the <info>version</info> parameter, it will be automatically.</comment>
extension:

    # Example:
    services:            
        web:                 
            volumes:             
                - ~/dev/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/custom.conf
            environment:         
                TEST:                1

makefile.name: makefile
makefile.info: <comment>You can add extra <info>makefile files</info>. You have to set absolute path, and you can use the <info>%wf.project_path%</info> placeholder or <info>~</info> (your home directory). You can use only these two path!</comment>
makefile.reference:
# <comment>You can add extra <info>makefile files</info>. You have to set absolute path, and you can use the <info>%wf.project_path%</info> placeholder or <info>~</info> (your home directory). You can use only these two path!</comment>
makefile:             [] # Example: ~/dev.mk

recipes.name: recipes
recipes.info: <comment>The configs of recipes. If you want to disable one from import, set the false value!</comment>
recipes.reference:
# <comment>The configs of recipes. If you want to disable one from import, set the false value!</comment>
recipes:

    # <comment>SMTP e-mail sender.</comment>
    mail:                 []

    # <comment>MailHog e-mail catcher. You can use the ports 1025 and 80.</comment>
    mailhog:

        # You can set a custom domain that you can use to allow the webpage. Set false if you don't want to use it.
        nginx_reverse_proxy_host: mailhog.%config.name%.loc # Example: mailhog.custom.loc

    # <comment>Include a MySQL service</comment>
    mysql:

        # <comment>Docker image tag</comment>
        version:              ~ # Required

        # <comment>Database name</comment>
        database:             ~ # Required

        # <comment>The <info>root</info> password.</comment>
        password:             ~ # Required

        # <comment>You can switch the using local volume.</comment>
        local_volume:         true

        # <comment>If you want to enable this container from outside set the port number. You can use these values:</comment>
        #  <info>false</info>        <comment>no create opened port number</comment>
        #  <info>0</info>            <comment>create a custom, random port number</comment>
        #  <info>[1-65535]</info>    <comment>use this port number</comment>
        port:                 false

    # <comment>Include multiple MySQL services</comment>
    mysql_multiple:

        # <comment>You can set some defaults for all containers!</comment>
        defaults:

            # <comment>Docker image tag</comment>
            version:              ~

            # <comment>The <info>root</info> password.</comment>
            password:             ~

            # <comment>You can switch the using local volume.</comment>
            local_volume:         ~

        # <comment>Configuration of the MySql containers.</comment>
        databases:

            # Prototype: <comment>The docker container name. You have to link through this! Eg: <info>mysql -u root -p -h [docker_container_name]</info>.</comment>
            docker_container_name:

                # <comment>Docker image tag</comment>
                version:              ~ # Required

                # <comment>Database name</comment>
                database:             ~ # Required

                # <comment>The <info>root</info> password.</comment>
                password:             ~ # Required

                # <comment>You can switch the using local volume.</comment>
                local_volume:         true

                # <comment>If you want to enable this container from outside set the port number. You can use these values:</comment>
                #  <info>false</info>        <comment>no create opened port number</comment>
                #  <info>0</info>            <comment>create a custom, random port number</comment>
                #  <info>[1-65535]</info>    <comment>use this port number</comment>
                port:                 false

    # <comment>You can enable the nginx-reverse-proxy.</comment>
    nginx_reverse_proxy:

        # <comment>The nginx-reverse-proxy network name.</comment>
        network_name:         reverse-proxy

        # <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>host</info> and <info>port</info> settings.</comment>
        settings:

            # Examples:
            service1:            ~
            service2:            
                host:                phpmyadmin.project.loc
                port:                81
            service3:            82

            # Prototype
            service:              ~

    # <comment>Symfony recipe</comment>
    symfony2:

        # <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
        version:              php7.1

        # <comment>Symfony environment.</comment>
        env:                  prod # Example: dev

        # <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
        http_auth:
            enabled:              false
            title:                'Private zone'
            htpasswd:             null

        # <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
        nginx:

            # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
            use_defaults:         true

            # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
            include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

        # <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
        share_base_user_configs: true

        # <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
        names:

            # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
            engine:               engine

            # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
            web:                  web

        # <comment>Server configuration</comment>
        server:

            # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
            host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
            xdebug:               false
            xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
            error_log:            true

            # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
            nginx_debug:          false

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
            max_post_size:        10M

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
            timeout:              '30'

            # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
            timezone:             Europe/Budapest

            # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
            locale:               en_US

        # <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
        project_dir:          .

    # <comment>Symfony recipe</comment>
    symfony3:

        # <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
        version:              php7.1

        # <comment>Symfony environment.</comment>
        env:                  prod # Example: dev

        # <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
        http_auth:
            enabled:              false
            title:                'Private zone'
            htpasswd:             null

        # <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
        nginx:

            # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
            use_defaults:         true

            # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
            include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

        # <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
        share_base_user_configs: true

        # <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
        names:

            # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
            engine:               engine

            # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
            web:                  web

        # <comment>Server configuration</comment>
        server:

            # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
            host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
            xdebug:               false
            xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
            error_log:            true

            # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
            nginx_debug:          false

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
            max_post_size:        10M

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
            timeout:              '30'

            # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
            timezone:             Europe/Budapest

            # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
            locale:               en_US

        # <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
        project_dir:          .

    # <comment>Symfony recipe</comment>
    symfony4:

        # <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
        version:              php7.3

        # <comment>Symfony environment.</comment>
        env:                  prod # Example: dev

        # <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
        http_auth:
            enabled:              false
            title:                'Private zone'
            htpasswd:             null

        # <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
        nginx:

            # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
            use_defaults:         true

            # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
            include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

        # <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
        share_base_user_configs: true

        # <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
        names:

            # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
            engine:               engine

            # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
            web:                  web

        # <comment>Server configuration</comment>
        server:

            # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
            host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
            xdebug:               false
            xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

            # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
            error_log:            true

            # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
            nginx_debug:          false

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
            max_post_size:        10M

            # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
            timeout:              '30'

            # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
            timezone:             Europe/Budapest

            # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
            locale:               en_US

        # <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
        project_dir:          .

    # <comment>Run the setted containers with your user permissions.</comment>
    user_fix:

        # <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>user</info>, <info>group</info> and other settings.</comment>
        services:

            # Prototype
            service:

                # <comment>The <info>username</info> what the container is using.</comment>
                user:                 ~ # Required, Example: mysql

                # <comment>The <info>group name</info> what the container is using.</comment>
                group:                ~ # Required, Example: mysql

                # <comment>The <info>original FULL entrypoint</info> what the container is using.</comment>
                entrypoint:           ~ # Required, Example: docker-entrypoint.sh mysqld

                # <comment>The <info>user ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the current user ID.</comment>
                uid:                  '${WWW_DATA_UID}' # Example: 1000

                # <comment>The <info>group ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the docker group ID.</comment>
                gid:                  '${WWW_DATA_GID}' # Example: 999

mailhog.name: mailhog
mailhog.info: <comment>MailHog e-mail catcher. You can use the ports 1025 and 80.</comment>
mailhog.reference:
# <comment>MailHog e-mail catcher. You can use the ports 1025 and 80.</comment>
mailhog:

    # You can set a custom domain that you can use to allow the webpage. Set false if you don't want to use it.
    nginx_reverse_proxy_host: mailhog.%config.name%.loc # Example: mailhog.custom.loc

nginx_reverse_proxy_host.name: nginx_reverse_proxy_host
nginx_reverse_proxy_host.info: You can set a custom domain that you can use to allow the webpage. Set false if you don't want to use it.
nginx_reverse_proxy_host.reference:
# You can set a custom domain that you can use to allow the webpage. Set false if you don't want to use it.
nginx_reverse_proxy_host: mailhog.%config.name%.loc # Example: mailhog.custom.loc

mysql.name: mysql

    # <comment>Docker image tag</comment>

    local_volume:         true

    #  <info>0</info>            <comment>create a custom, random port number</comment>
    #  <info>[1-65535]</info>    <comment>use this port number</comment>
    port:                 false

local_volume.name: local_volume
local_volume.info: <comment>You can switch the using local volume.</comment>

# <comment>You can switch the using local volume.</comment>

 <info>false</info>        <comment>no create opened port number</comment>

 <info>false</info>        <comment>no create opened port number</comment>

    # <comment>The nginx-reverse-proxy network name.</comment>
    network_name:         reverse-proxy

    # <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>host</info> and <info>port</info> settings.</comment>

        # Examples:
        service1:            ~
        service2:            
            host:                phpmyadmin.project.loc
            port:                81
        service3:            82

        # Prototype
        service:              ~

settings.name: settings
settings.info: <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>host</info> and <info>port</info> settings.</comment>
settings.yaml_example:
service1: '~'
service2:
    host: phpmyadmin.project.loc
    port: 81
service3: 82
settings.reference:
# <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>host</info> and <info>port</info> settings.</comment>
settings:

    # Examples:
    service1:            ~
    service2:            
        host:                phpmyadmin.project.loc
        port:                81
    service3:            82

    # Prototype
    service:              ~

symfony2.name: symfony2
symfony2.reference:
# <comment>Symfony recipe</comment>
symfony2:

    # <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
    version:              php7.1

    # <comment>Symfony environment.</comment>
    env:                  prod # Example: dev

    # <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
    http_auth:
        enabled:              false
        title:                'Private zone'
        htpasswd:             null

    # <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
    nginx:

        # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
        use_defaults:         true

        # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
        include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

    # <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
    share_base_user_configs: true

    # <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
    names:

        # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
        engine:               engine

        # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
        web:                  web

    # <comment>Server configuration</comment>
    server:

        # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
        host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

        # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
        xdebug:               false
        xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

        # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
        error_log:            true

        # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
        nginx_debug:          false

        # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
        max_post_size:        10M

        # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
        timeout:              '30'

        # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
        timezone:             Europe/Budapest

        # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
        locale:               en_US

    # <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
    project_dir:          .

version.name: version
version.info: <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
version.reference:
# <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
version:              php7.1

http_auth.name: http_auth
http_auth.info: <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
http_auth.reference:
# <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
http_auth:
    enabled:              false
    title:                'Private zone'
    htpasswd:             null

nginx.name: nginx
nginx.info: <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
nginx.reference:
# <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
nginx:

    # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
    use_defaults:         true

    # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
    include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

use_defaults.name: use_defaults
use_defaults.info: <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
use_defaults.reference:

share_base_user_configs.info: <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>

    # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>

    # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
    host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

    # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
    xdebug:               false
    xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

    # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
    error_log:            true

    # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
    nginx_debug:          false

    # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
    max_post_size:        10M

    # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
    timeout:              '30'

    # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
    timezone:             Europe/Budapest

    # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
    locale:               en_US

symfony3.name: symfony3
symfony3.reference:
# <comment>Symfony recipe</comment>
symfony3:

    # <comment>Docker image tag. If you want to change image too, use the <info>image</info> option.</comment>
    version:              php7.1

    # <comment>Symfony environment.</comment>
    env:                  prod # Example: dev

    # <comment>You can generate a user-password string here: http://www.htaccesstools.com/htpasswd-generator/ ( --> <info>htpasswd</info>).</comment>
    http_auth:
        enabled:              false
        title:                'Private zone'
        htpasswd:             null

    # <comment>You can register an nginx config file that will be inculded into the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
    nginx:

        # <comment>If you want to use custom locals or anything else, you can switch off to use default "local settings" in the <info>server</info> block.</comment>
        use_defaults:         true

        # <comment>You have to use a custom <info>server</info> block. You have to use docker <info>volumes</info> format!</comment>
        include_file:         null # Example: %wf.project_path%/.docker/web/error_pages.conf:/etc/nginx/error_pages.conf

    # <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
    share_base_user_configs: true

    # <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
    names:

        # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
        engine:               engine

        # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
        web:                  web

    # <comment>Server configuration</comment>
    server:

        # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
        host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

        # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
        xdebug:               false
        xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

        # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
        error_log:            true

        # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
        nginx_debug:          false

        # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
        max_post_size:        10M

        # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
        timeout:              '30'

        # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
        timezone:             Europe/Budapest

        # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
        locale:               en_US

    # <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
    project_dir:          .

share_base_user_configs.info: <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
share_base_user_configs.reference:
# <comment>Here you can switch off or on to use user's .gitconfig, .ssh and .composer configs. Maybe you should switch off on CI.</comment>
share_base_user_configs: true

names.name: names
names.reference:
# <comment>You can change the service names</comment>
names:

    # <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
    engine:               engine

    # <comment>The name of web service</comment>
    web:                  web

engine.name: engine
engine.reference:
# <comment>The name of engine/default cli service</comment>
engine:               engine

web.name: web
web.reference:
# <comment>The name of web service</comment>
web:                  web

server.name: server
server.reference:
# <comment>Server configuration</comment>
server:

    # <comment>Only for nginx. Here you can set the host. See: etc/vhost.conf file</comment>
    host:                 localhost # Deprecated (We are using the `_` special settings so it may be redundant!), Example: project.docker.company.com

    # <comment>You can switch on and off the xdebug.</comment>
    xdebug:               false
    xdebug_ide_server_name: Docker

    # <comment>You can switch on and off the PHP error log. (default is ON!)</comment>
    error_log:            true

    # <comment>You can switch on and off debug mode. IMPORTANT! The debug mode makes lot of logs!</comment>
    nginx_debug:          false

    # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>client_max_body_size</info> and php <info>max_post</info> and <info>max_file_upload</info>.</comment>
    max_post_size:        10M

    # <comment>You can set the nginx <info>fastcgi_read_timeout</info> and php <info>max_execution_time</info>.</comment>
    timeout:              '30'

    # <comment>You can set the server timezone. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>/etc/timezone</info> file.</comment>
    timezone:             Europe/Budapest

    # <comment>You can set the server locale. The default is your/host machine system setting from the <info>$_ENV[LOCALE]</info></comment>
    locale:               en_US

project_dir.name: project_dir
project_dir.info: <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
project_dir.reference:
# <comment>You can set a subdirectory where the doc root is.</comment>
project_dir:          .

user_fix.name: user_fix
user_fix.info: <comment>Run the setted containers with your user permissions.</comment>
user_fix.reference:
# <comment>Run the setted containers with your user permissions.</comment>
user_fix:

    # <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>user</info>, <info>group</info> and other settings.</comment>
    services:

        # Prototype
        service:

            # <comment>The <info>username</info> what the container is using.</comment>
            user:                 ~ # Required, Example: mysql

            # <comment>The <info>group name</info> what the container is using.</comment>
            group:                ~ # Required, Example: mysql

            # <comment>The <info>original FULL entrypoint</info> what the container is using.</comment>
            entrypoint:           ~ # Required, Example: docker-entrypoint.sh mysqld

            # <comment>The <info>user ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the current user ID.</comment>
            uid:                  '${WWW_DATA_UID}' # Example: 1000

            # <comment>The <info>group ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the docker group ID.</comment>
            gid:                  '${WWW_DATA_GID}' # Example: 999

services.name: services
services.info: <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>user</info>, <info>group</info> and other settings.</comment>
services.reference:
# <comment>You have to set the service and its <info>user</info>, <info>group</info> and other settings.</comment>
services:

    # Prototype
    service:

        # <comment>The <info>username</info> what the container is using.</comment>
        user:                 ~ # Required, Example: mysql

        # <comment>The <info>group name</info> what the container is using.</comment>
        group:                ~ # Required, Example: mysql

        # <comment>The <info>original FULL entrypoint</info> what the container is using.</comment>
        entrypoint:           ~ # Required, Example: docker-entrypoint.sh mysqld

        # <comment>The <info>user ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the current user ID.</comment>
        uid:                  '${WWW_DATA_UID}' # Example: 1000

        # <comment>The <info>group ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the docker group ID.</comment>
        gid:                  '${WWW_DATA_GID}' # Example: 999

    # <comment>The <info>user ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the current user ID.</comment>
    uid:                  '${WWW_DATA_UID}' # Example: 1000

    # <comment>The <info>group ID</info> what we want to use. If you don't set it, then it uses the docker group ID.</comment>
    gid:                  '${WWW_DATA_GID}' # Example: 999
